# COMMENT ON

`COMMENT ON ...` adds or updates the comment of an object.

## Syntax

<div class="rr-diagram">

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

</div>

## Details

`COMMENT ON` stores a comment about an object in the database. Each
object can only have one comment associated with it, so successive calls
of `COMMENT ON` to a single object will overwrite the previous comment.

To read the comment on an object you need to query the
[mz_internal.mz_comments](/docs/self-managed/v25.2/sql/system-catalog/mz_internal/#mz_comments)
catalog table.

## Privileges

The privileges required to execute this statement are:

- Ownership of the object being commented on (unless the object is a
  role).
- To comment on a role, you must have the `CREATEROLE` privilege.

For more information on ownership and privileges, see [Role-based access
control](/docs/self-managed/v25.2/manage/access-control/).

## Examples

<div class="highlight">

``` chroma
--- Add comments.
COMMENT ON TABLE foo IS 'this table is important';
COMMENT ON COLUMN foo.x IS 'holds all of the important data';

--- Update a comment.
COMMENT ON TABLE foo IS 'holds non-important data';

--- Remove a comment.
COMMENT ON TABLE foo IS NULL;

--- Read comments.
SELECT * FROM mz_internal.mz_comments;
```

</div>

</div>
